definition: In Australian Federal Law, breastfeeding is a right, not a privilege.

title: What to do when unsure about breastfeeding or expressing in our stores
steps: Seek help from your Store Manager if you are unsure.

title: What to do if you receive a complaint
steps: If you receive a complaint from a customer you may advise them that this is a women's right under Australian Federal Law.
If you are uncomfortable, unsure, or if the complaint escalates seek help from your Store Manager.

name: Managing Threatening Situations - Kmart Way module
Customer Greeter and bag check module

title: Entry - Customer Service Standards
steps: Welcome each customer as they enter the store with a greeting and a smile.
Assist customers with enquiries such as product locations and direct customers for refunds or exchanges to the Service Desk, and alert the team via P2T.
Report suspicious behaviour discreetly using P2T whilst adhering to the Managing Threatening Situations - 4Ds Poster.

Manage visitors and contractors who arrive at the store by informing the management team, ensuring they scan in attendance using the Verified QR code, and applying checkseal on Team Member, visitor, or contractor goods.
Monitor trolley and basket availability and use P2T to notify a manager if replenishment is required.

title: Exit - Customer Service Standards
steps: Farewell each customer and ask if they found everything they were looking for.
Request the receipt to scan as per the receipt scan process and conduct bag checks to ensure the total items on the receipt match what is in their bag, trolley, pram, or box.
Report suspicious behaviour discreetly using P2T whilst adhering to the Managing Threatening Situations - 4Ds Poster.

Manage visitors and contractors who exit the store by informing the management team, ensuring they scan out attendance using the Verified QR code, and checking checkseal on Team Member, visitor, or contractor goods.
Ask for assistance to queue bust while checking receipts with the receipt scanner.
